intro: Dryandra carlinoides, commonly known as the Carlin’s dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height, often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
